summary: The Indian Health Service delivers health care to American Indians and Alaska Natives. Much of IHS facilities' funding comes from third-party collections—payments for patients' medical care received from public programs (such as Medicare) or from private insurers. IHS relies on these funds to procure medical supplies and services needed for its operations. IHS's facilities report data on their collections to IHS headquarters twice a year...
title: Indian Health Service: Information on Third-Party Collections and Processes to Procure Supplies and Services
